intro: Actinodium cunninghamii, commonly known as the narrow-leafed actinodium, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, white flowers in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is often found in heathlands and woodlands, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
